exercises.title: Some, Any, None, No | Grammar Exercise

questions.question: 'Which dress should I wear?' '.............................. will do.'
Can you see .......................... parrots over there?
questions.description: Use any in questions and negatives use some in affirmative sentences.

questions.question: 'Are there ............................ apples in the fridge?'
questions.description: Use any in negatives and questions.

questions.question: The traveller asked for food but there was .............................. in the house.
He didn't show ............................ remorse.
questions.description: Use any in questions and negatives use some in affirmative sentences.

questions.question: She doesn't have .............................. interest in politics.
questions.description: Use any in questions and negatives use some in affirmative sentences.

questions.question: Can I have .............................. more coffee?
questions.description: Some is used in questions when we expect an yes for answer.

questions.question: She has got hardly ................................. friends.
questions.description: Hardly any means more or less the same as no.

questions.question: He has five children but ................................. of them lives with him.
I called her in the afternoon but there was ................................. answer.
If you receive .................................. information, let me know.
You have never offered me ................................ help.
